roleset.name: to force or drive out, to discharge from
roleset.note: EXPEL-V NOTES: Frames file for 'expel' based on survey of sentences in the WSJ corpus. (from expel.01-v predicate notes)
EXPULSION-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT, expel.01. Corresponds to VNcls banish-10.2, fire-10.10, remove-10.1. (from expulsion.01-n)

example.name: passive with Arg2
example.text: [Two firms]-150 were expelled [*-150]from the NASD , three were suspended or barred [*-1] and nine were fined [*-151] .

example.name: passive with ArgM-CAU
example.text: [First Securities Group of California and a principal of the firm , Louis Fernando Vargas of Marina del Rey , Calif. ,]-1 were jointly fined [*-1]$ 15,000 [*U*] and expelled [*-1] for alleged violations of reporting requirements on securities sales .
example.arg: for alleged violations of reporting requirements on securities sales

example.name: TMP
example.text: The ones who are students at UC - Davis deserve immediate expulsion .

example.name: args 0, 1
example.text: For decades there has been a continuing effort by Israelis to cover up their expulsion of the 750,000 refugees who fled their homes during the 1948 war.
example.arg: of the 750,000 refugees who fled their homes during the 1948 war
